stories.text:
I am researching software engineering internships to share with my students, who are from a variety of backgrounds (high school, college, currently working, and some unemployed folks). They've all have less than 1 year of experience coding and are looking for opportunities to get some more hands on experience.

What are some good places to look for opportunities that would be valuable to them?
stories.title: Ask HN: Where to look for software engineering internships?
Australia election: How climate is making Australia more unliveable
How does it make sense for the universe to have started from a big bang?
The supergraph: a new way to think about GraphQL

stories.text:
Hello Friends, hope this is relatable to you.

I think i spend too much time in the REPL and in documentations. I like learning new things, and testing them out in an interactive environment, without bothering to deploy at some point. I might write 20 different versions of a Method, just to discard it in the end. In my mind, this is not wasted time, but my Employer might think differently. I want to impress him with my skills, but can't bring myself to produce anything usable. At its core, it is Escapism. How do I get my Head out of my Ass and start producing?
stories.title: Ask HN: Tinkering Too Much?
To Restore Civil Society, Start with the Library (2018)
